author: Martijnsummer
post_text: April 14, 2017 at 12:31 PM#1Hi,it is a bug or a feature?this commandline does not work. Does anyone have some suggestions?Setuservar $Name ("Set name")Assign Executor $Selectedexec cue 1 /cmd="off exec $"Name[color=#FF0000]""[/color]thanks a lotwith kind regards,Martijn

posts.author: Martijnsummer
posts.post_text: April 14, 2017 at 12:31 PM#1Hi,it is a bug or a feature?this commandline does not work. Does anyone have some suggestions?Setuservar $Name ("Set name")Assign Executor $Selectedexec cue 1 /cmd="off exec $"Name[color=#FF0000]""[/color]thanks a lotwith kind regards,Martijn

posts.author: PinceDeCrabe
posts.post_text: April 14, 2017 at 4:07 PM#2Setuservar $NameAssign Executor $Selectedexec cue 1 /cmd="off exec $Name"work fine

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 15, 2017 at 4:38 PM#3you cannot use quotes inside quotes.Assign Executor $Selectedexec cue 1 /cmd="off exec $Name"is valid, but requires name to be unique and without spaces.be however aware that the variable called $Name will not be resolved during the Assign syntax (as it is inside quotes) and the CMD will literally be "off exec $Name", thus the variable gets resolved first when cue is run and CMD is executed

posts.author: I-allu-I
posts.post_text: November 23, 2017 at 9:28 AM#4Hi,Did we get any solution for this?Thanks in advance-Alex

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 25, 2017 at 2:29 AM#5Setvar $cmd = "Off Exec "Addvar $cmd = $"Name"Assign Cue x /cmd=$"cmd"

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: November 27, 2017 at 11:11 PM#6HiAvoid space in names if you want to use macros and variables.Use underline : my_name

title: name in cmd line
